quest_title: The average velocity of a body moving with uniform acceleration travelling a distance of 3.06 m is 0.34 ms–1. If the change in velocity of the body is 0.18ms–1 during this time, its uniform acceleration is
explanation_txt: \(\begin{array} { l } { \text { Time } = \cfrac { \text { Distance } } { \text { Average velocity } } = \cfrac { 3.06 } { 0.34 } = 9 \text { sec } } \\ { \text { Acceleration } = \cfrac { \text { Change in velocity } } { \text { Time } } = \cfrac { 0.18 } { 9 } = 0.02 \mathrm { m } / \mathrm { s } ^ { 2 } } \end{array}\)

quest_title: The moment of inertia of a body depends on
ans2_txt: The distribution of the mass in the body
ans3_txt: The axis of rotation of the body
explanation_txt:
Let, line perpendicular to \(XY\) plane which passes through O be the axis of rotation for the body M.

\(I_{dm}=dmr^{2}\)

\(I_{dm}=dm(x^{2}+y^{2})\)

From the relation above, moment of inertia depends upon mass and its position from the axis of rotation of the body.
question_plain_title: The moment of inertia of a body depends on
explanation_plain_text:
Let, line perpendicular to plane which passes through O be the axis of rotation for the body M.

ans3_plain_text: The axis of rotation of the body

quest_title: A capacitor of capacitance 1 \(\mu\)F is charged to a potential of 1 V. It is connected in parallel to an inductor of inductance 10\({}^{-3}\)\(\mu H\). The maximum current that will flow in the circuit has the value
explanation_txt:
\(\begin{aligned} \text { Charge on capacitor } q_{0} &=V \times C \\ &=1 \times 10^{-6} \mathrm{V} \\ &=10^{-6} \mathrm{Coulomb} \end{aligned} \)
\(\therefore q=q_{0} \sin \omega t\)
\(i=\cfrac{d q}{d t}=q_{0} \omega \)
\(\omega=\cfrac{1}{\sqrt{L C}}=\cfrac{1}{\sqrt{10^{-9}}}=\left(10^{9}\right)^{1 / 2} \)
\(I_{0}=10^{-6} \times 9 / 2 \mathrm{Amp}=\sqrt{1000} \mathrm{mA} \)

quest_title: According to law of mass action rate of a chemical reaction is proportional to
explanation_txt: According to law of mass-action, “at a given temperature, the rate of a reaction at a particular instant is proportional to the product of the active masses of the reactants at that instant raised to powers which are numerically equal to the numbers of their respective molecules in the stoichiometric equation describing the reaction”.

quest_title: The domain of \(f(x) = \cfrac {x^2 - 6x + 5}{x^2 -6x + 8} \) is:
explanation_txt:
\(f(x) = \cfrac {x^2 - 6x + 5}{x^2 -6x + 8} \)

\(f(x) = \cfrac {x^2 - 6x + 5}{(x-2)(x-4)} \)

For denominator to be non-zero, \(x\) can't be 2 or 4 but can take every other real value. So, the correct answer is (b).
question_plain_title: The domain of is:
explanation_plain_text: For denominator to be non-zero, can't be 2 or 4 but can take every other real value. So, the correct answer is (b).

quest_title: What is the amount of NaOH required to neutralize 100ml of 0.1N \(\text{H\({}_{2}\)SO\({}_{4}\)?}\)
explanation_txt:
It takes 100 ml of 0.1N NaOH to neutralize 100 ml of 0.1N H\(_2\)SO\(_4\).

No. of gram equivalents = 0.1*0.1=0.01

\(\therefore\) Amount of NaOH required = no. of gram equivalents \(\times\) Equivalent weight of NaOH = 0.01*40 = 0.4 gm
question_plain_title: What is the amount of NaOH required to neutralize 100ml of 0.1N
explanation_plain_text:
It takes 100 ml of 0.1N NaOH to neutralize 100 ml of 0.1N HSO.

No. of gram equivalents = 0.1*0.1=0.01

Amount of NaOH required = no. of gram equivalents Equivalent weight of NaOH = 0.01*40 = 0.4 gm

quest_title: A uniform electric field and a uniform magnetic field are produced, pointed in the same direction. An electron is projected with its velocity pointing in the same direction
ans1_txt: The electron will turn to its right
ans2_txt: The electron will turn to its left
ans3_txt: The electron velocity will increase in magnitude
ans4_txt: The electron velocity will decrease in magnitude
explanation_txt:
Since electron is moving is parallel to the magnetic field, hence magnetic force on it \(F_{m} =0\).

The only force acting on the electron is electric force which reduces it's speed.
question_plain_title: A uniform electric field and a uniform magnetic field are produced, pointed in the same direction. An electron is projected with its velocity pointing in the same direction
explanation_plain_text:

The only force acting on the electron is electric force which reduces it's speed.
ans1_plain_text: The electron will turn to its right

quest_title: Which of the following solutions will have pH close to 1.0 ?
explanation_txt:
For \(HCl\), \([H^+]=N=M\)

Since,

\( N = \cfrac{N_aV_a-N_bV_b}{V_a+V_b} \\ \Rightarrow pH = - \text{antilog} \left( \cfrac{NaV_a-N_bV_b}{V_a+V_b} \right) \)

\(pH\) is calculated for different options:

Option \(N_a\) \(V_a\) \(N_b\) \(V_b\) \(N\) \(pH\)
a 0.1 0.1 0.1 0.1 - 7
b 0.1 0.055 0.1 0.045 0.01 2
c 0.1 0.01 0.1 0.09 0.08 basic \(\approx 13\)
d 0.2 0.075 0.1 0.025 0.125 \(\approx 1\)

Option

quest_title: An element x has mass number 32 and atomic number 16. It's ion is therefore;
explanation_txt:
mass number = proton + neutron = 32

atomic number = proton = 16

For neutral atom, electron = proton = 16

The electronic configuration would be: 1s2 2s22p6 3s23p4

It needs two electrons to form octet, thus the ion would be X2-.
question_plain_title: An element x has mass number 32 and atomic number 16. It's ion is therefore;
explanation_plain_text:
mass number = proton + neutron = 32

atomic number = proton = 16

For neutral atom, electron = proton = 16

The electronic configuration would be: 1s2 2s22p6 3s23p4

It needs two electrons to form octet, thus the ion would be X2-.

quest_title: The angular momentum of electron in \(\textit{n}\)\({}^{th}\) orbit is given by
explanation_txt:
Bohr's second postulate states that the angular momentum of electrons in stationary orbit is an integral multiple of \(\cfrac{h}{2\pi}\).

\(L=mvr=n\cfrac{h}{2\pi}\)

quest_title: Which of the following is the empty set
ans1_txt: \(\{ x:x\) is a real number and \(x^{2} -1=0\} \)

quest_title: If in a \( \Delta A B C , \angle A = 45 ^ { \circ } , \angle C = 60 ^ { \circ } \), then \( a + c \sqrt { 2 } = \)
explanation_txt:
\( A = 45 ^ { \circ } , C = 60 ^ { \circ } , A + B + C = \pi \Rightarrow B = 75 ^ { \circ } \)

\( \begin{array} { c } { \Rightarrow a + c \sqrt { 2 } = k \sin A + k \sin C ( \sqrt { 2 } ) } \\ { = k \sin 45 ^ { \circ } + \sqrt { 2 } k \sin 60 ^ { \circ } } \\ { = 2 k \left( \cfrac { \sqrt { 3 } + 1 } { 2 \sqrt { 2 } } \right) = 2 k \sin 75 ^ { \circ } = 2 k \sin B } \end{array} \)

\( \therefore a + c \sqrt { 2 } = 2 b \)
